result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone Evans Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay applicable surcharge. To be paid by 4/1/2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.
-Court waived all other Court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone Evans Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered defendant to serve 57 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 57 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicible surcharge. Defendant to pay surcharge by 4/1/2016 or a civil judgment will be entered. 

Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Defendant Tyrone Evans in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Tyrone Evans not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Per request from the Department of Corrections and on motion of defense, Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Tyrone Evans not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant was in custody on the last court date and may be at a halfway house as an alternative to revocation on the next date.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyrone Evans in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Tyrone Evans in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyrone Evans Jr
Current: 1425 Northwestern Ave, Green Bay, WI 54303 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2015)
Prior: 3519 North 23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Order to Produce for Return on Warrant/Initial Appearance on July 14, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyrone Evans in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tyrone Evans in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
